label: ham
subject:
Rev 5346: typofix in
	http://samba.sernet.de/ma/bzr/SAMBA_3_0-registry.bzr/
body: Sect. 104. But to conclude, reason being plain on our side, that men are naturally free, and the examples of history shewing, that the governments of the world, that were begun in peace, had their beginning laid on that foundation, and were made by the consent of the people; there can be little room for doubt, either where the right is, or what has been the opinion, or practice of mankind, about the first erecting of governments.
